hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from al-A'mash: Regarding the reading of Abdullah: (Quran 20:13): 'And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed.' He said: We chose you. Regarding His statement (20:15): 'The Hour is coming, I am about to hide it.' He said: From myself. Regarding His statement (20:18): 'I have other needs.' He said: Other requirements. Regarding His statement (20:22): 'And put your hand to your side.' He said: He put it under his armpit, white without defect. Regarding His statement (20:40): 'And We saved you from sorrow.' He said: From killing.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from a man, from Sa'id ibn Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas: Regarding (Quran 20:40): 'And We tested you with trials.' He said: We tested you with tests. Regarding His statement (Surah Al-Naba 78:6): 'Did We not make the earth a bed.' Regarding His statement (Quran 20:59): 'And that the people be gathered in the forenoon.' He said: It is not the Day of Resurrection, but rather the day of Pharaoh and Moses. Regarding His statement (20:59): 'In the forenoon.' He said: The sun.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ismail ibn Abi Khalid, from Abu Salih: Regarding His statement (Quran 20:63): 'And they will take away your way, the right one.' He said: The elite of the people. The companions of Abdullah used to read it: 'The stratagem of magic.' Regarding His statement (20:80-81): 'Children of Israel, We have saved you from your enemy and made a covenant with you on the right side of the Mount, and We sent down to you manna and quail, eat from the good of what We have provided for you.' Regarding His statement (20:82): 'For those who repent, believe, and do righteous deeds, then are guided.' He said: Repented of sins, believed in monotheism, did righteous deeds then fasted and prayed, and knew that it has a reward. Regarding His statement (20:100): 'Whoever turns away from it will bear a burden on the Day of Resurrection.' He said: The burden is polytheism. Regarding His statement (20:106-107): 'So We will leave it as a plain level ground, you cannot see in it any curve nor flatness.' He said: The earth will appear completely level. The curve is the crack and the flatness is the elevated place. Regarding His statement (20:108): 'The caller with no deviation from it.' He said: No deviation from it. Regarding His statement (20:108): 'You will not hear except a whisper.' He said: The footsteps of feet. Regarding His statement (20:111): 'Faces will be humbled.' He said: They will be abased and degraded. Regarding His statement (20:111): 'Whoever has borne injustice has failed.' He said: Injustice is polytheism. Regarding His statement (20:112): 'Will not fear injustice or diminishment.' He said: Injustice is when his right is wronged, and diminishment is when some of his right is diminished. Regarding His statement (Surah Al-Jinn 72:13): 'Will not fear diminishment or burden.' He said: All of his right is diminished, and burden means some of his right is diminished. Regarding His statement (20:115): 'He forgot and We did not find in him determination.' He said: Preservation (memory).
